item.title: A Neglected Family Of Killer Viruses
item.description: September 20, 2017 - The five hepatitis viruses claim over 1 million lives each year. Yet the attention — and funding — can't compete with HIV, TB and malaria.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 20, 2017 - The five hepatitis viruses claim over 1 million lives each year. Yet the attention — and funding — can't compete with HIV, TB and malaria. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/09/20/552118635/a-neglected-family-of-killer-viruses

item.title: Hurricane Maria Leaves Hospital In Puerto Rico Running On Generator Power
item.description: September 20, 2017 - NPR's Ari Shapiro speaks to Domingo Cruz Vivaldi, an administrator at the San Jorge Children's Hospital in San Juan, Puerto Rico as Hurricane Maria's trajectory is affecting the island.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 20, 2017 - NPR's Ari Shapiro speaks to Domingo Cruz Vivaldi, an administrator at the San Jorge Children's Hospital in San Juan, Puerto Rico as Hurricane Maria's trajectory is affecting the island. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/20/552418215/hurricane-maria-leaves-hospital-in-puerto-rico-running-on-generator-power

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel Says Sen. Cassidy Fell Short Of Standard For Obamacare Repeal
item.description: September 20, 2017 - Late-night host Jimmy Kimmel credits good healthcare to saving the life of his newborn son. That led Sen. Bill Cassidy (R-La.), a medical doctor, to say that any replacement of the Affordable Care Act should pass "The Jimmy Kimmel Test." Now, Kimmel says Cassidy has fallen short of that with his new bill being considered by Congress.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 20, 2017 - Late-night host Jimmy Kimmel credits good healthcare to saving the life of his newborn son. That led Sen. Bill Cassidy (R-La.), a medical doctor, to say that any replacement of the Affordable Care Act should pass "The Jimmy Kimmel Test." Now, Kimmel says Cassidy has fallen short of that with his new bill being considered by Congress. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/20/552418180/jimmy-kimmel-says-sen-cassidy-fell-short-of-standard-for-obamacare-repeal

item.title: Senate Republicans Up Against Sept. 30 Deadline For Last Effort To Replace Obamacare
item.description: September 20, 2017 - Senate Republicans may vote next week — again — on repealing the Affordable Care Act. The latest bill is sponsored by Senator Lindsey Graham of South Carolina and Senator Bill Cassidy of Louisiana.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 20, 2017 - Senate Republicans may vote next week — again — on repealing the Affordable Care Act. The latest bill is sponsored by Senator Lindsey Graham of South Carolina and Senator Bill Cassidy of Louisiana. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/20/552418173/senate-republicans-up-against-sept-30-deadline-for-last-effort-to-replace-obamac

item.title: These GOP Senators Could Block Republicans' Obamacare Repeal
item.description: September 20, 2017 - Republicans are very close to having the votes to pass a repeal of the Affordable Care Act in the Senate next week, and it has come down to the votes of three undecided GOP senators.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 20, 2017 - Republicans are very close to having the votes to pass a repeal of the Affordable Care Act in the Senate next week, and it has come down to the votes of three undecided GOP senators. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/20/552362082/these-gop-senators-could-block-republicans-obamacare-repeal

item.title: Editing Embryo DNA Yields Clues About Early Human Development
item.description: September 20, 2017 - Researchers disabled a gene that they think helps determine which human embryos will develop normally. The technique they used is controversial because it could be used to change babies' DNA.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 20, 2017 - Researchers disabled a gene that they think helps determine which human embryos will develop normally. The technique they used is controversial because it could be used to change babies' DNA. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/09/20/551779921/editing-embryo-dna-yields-clues-about-early-human-development

item.title: Bemoaning Budget Cuts, Health Care Navigators Say Feds Don't Get It
item.description: September 20, 2017 - The federal government has sharply cut funding to groups that help people enroll in health plans. But the groups say federal officials don't understand how much help and follow-up some people need.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 20, 2017 - The federal government has sharply cut funding to groups that help people enroll in health plans. But the groups say federal officials don't understand how much help and follow-up some people need. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/09/20/552094974/bemoaning-budget-cuts-health-care-navigators-say-feds-dont-get-it

item.title: 41 States To Investigate Pharmaceutical Companies Over Opioids
item.description: September 19, 2017 - The states' attorneys general are banding together to investigate the makers and distributors of powerful opioid painkillers that have led to a spike in opiate addictions and overdose deaths.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 19, 2017 - The states' attorneys general are banding together to investigate the makers and distributors of powerful opioid painkillers that have led to a spike in opiate addictions and overdose deaths. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/09/19/552135830/41-states-to-investigate-pharmaceutical-companies-over-opioids

item.title: Latest GOP Effort To Replace Obamacare Could End Health Care For Millions
item.description: September 19, 2017 - Republicans are taking one last shot at repealing and replacing the Affordable Care Act, also known as Obamacare. But the new plan isn't much different from the last one that failed.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 19, 2017 - Republicans are taking one last shot at repealing and replacing the Affordable Care Act, also known as Obamacare. But the new plan isn't much different from the last one that failed. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/09/19/552044236/latest-gop-effort-to-replace-obamacare-could-end-health-care-for-millions

item.title: Many Nursing Homes Aren't Prepared For Even Basic Emergencies
item.description: September 19, 2017 - The deaths of eight residents in a Florida nursing home showed how even seemingly mundane things like failing to maintain climate control can be deadly. Emergency preparation enforcement can be lax.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 19, 2017 - The deaths of eight residents in a Florida nursing home showed how even seemingly mundane things like failing to maintain climate control can be deadly. Emergency preparation enforcement can be lax. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/09/19/552042095/many-nursing-homes-arent-prepared-for-even-basic-emergencies

item.title: When Irma Arrived, Most Florida Health Care Facilities Were Ready
item.description: September 19, 2017 - Eight deaths at a Florida nursing home got a lot of media attention. But a tour of other health care centers in the Miami area found mostly good care after Hurricane Irma struck.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 19, 2017 - Eight deaths at a Florida nursing home got a lot of media attention. But a tour of other health care centers in the Miami area found mostly good care after Hurricane Irma struck. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/09/19/551920301/when-irma-arrived-most-florida-health-care-facilities-were-ready

item.title: Bangladesh Copes With Chaos: Rohingya Refugees Are 'Coming And Coming'
item.description: September 18, 2017 - Over 400,000 Rohingya have fled Myanmar for Bangladesh in just the past three weeks. Aid agencies and the Bangladesh government are struggling to cope.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 18, 2017 - Over 400,000 Rohingya have fled Myanmar for Bangladesh in just the past three weeks. Aid agencies and the Bangladesh government are struggling to cope. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/09/18/551869474/bangladesh-copes-with-chaos-rohingya-refugees-are-coming-and-coming

item.title: One Of America's Biggest Food Banks Just Cut Junk Food By 84 Percent In A Year
item.description: September 18, 2017 - D.C'.s Capital Area Food Bank is part of a growing trend to move toward healthier options in food assistance, because many in the population it serves suffer from high blood pressure and diabetes.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 18, 2017 - D.C'.s Capital Area Food Bank is part of a growing trend to move toward healthier options in food assistance, because many in the population it serves suffer from high blood pressure and diabetes. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/09/18/551796954/one-of-americas-biggest-food-banks-just-cut-junk-food-by-84-percent-in-a-year

item.title: As Federal Government Cuts Obamacare Ads, Private Insurer Steps Up
item.description: September 18, 2017 - The federal government has cut advertising for the Affordable Care Act's enrollment period by 90 percent. So insurer Oscar Health has started its own campaign in New York and five other states.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 18, 2017 - The federal government has cut advertising for the Affordable Care Act's enrollment period by 90 percent. So insurer Oscar Health has started its own campaign in New York and five other states. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/09/18/551776441/as-federal-government-cuts-obamacare-ads-private-insurer-steps-up

item.title: The Problem With Free Menstrual Pads
item.description: September 18, 2017 - Governments in countries across Africa have promised to deliver free menstrual pads to girls. But are they getting the details right?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 18, 2017 - Governments in countries across Africa have promised to deliver free menstrual pads to girls. But are they getting the details right? http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/09/18/547108709/the-problem-with-free-menstrual-pads
